name: Thai Coconut Soup
description: Recipe video above. This amazing quick & easy Thai Coconut Soup is made from scratch!! Tastes like a Thai coconut curry, a cross between Tom Yum and Laksa soups. This recipe is all about the soup broth, so put whatever you want into the soup! This is the noodle soup version of this Poached Salmon in Coconut Lime Sauce.
recipeIngredient: 2 tsp chilli garlic paste or other chilli paste (, adjust to taste (Note 4))
200 g / 7 oz   fresh egg noodles, (prepared per packet (other noodles Note 6))
Sliced red onion ((or sliced green onion), Fried Asian shallots (Note 7), sliced red chilli, more chilli paste (optional))

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add prawns and sear both sides until light golden (doesn't need to cook inside). Remove onto plate.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil in a large saucepan over high heat. Add prawns and sear both sides until light golden (doesn't need to cook inside). Remove onto plate.

recipeInstructions.text: Turn heat down to medium. If pot is looking dry, add a touch of extra oil.
recipeInstructions.name: Turn heat down to medium. If pot is looking dry, add a touch of extra oil.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic, ginger and lemongrass. Saute for 20 seconds until garlic is golden.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic, ginger and lemongrass. Saute for 20 seconds until garlic is golden.

recipeInstructions.text: Add sugar and fish sauce. Stir and cook for 30 seconds - it should look like caramel.
recipeInstructions.name: Add sugar and fish sauce. Stir and cook for 30 seconds - it should look like caramel.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chilli paste, coriander and curry powder. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chilli paste, coriander and curry powder. Stir and cook for 30 seconds.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken broth and coconut milk. Stir and bring to simmer.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken broth and coconut milk. Stir and bring to simmer.

recipeInstructions.text: Simmer for 2 minutes, then add lime zest and return prawns into broth.
recipeInstructions.name: Simmer for 2 minutes, then add lime zest and return prawns into broth.

recipeInstructions.text: Cook for 2 minutes just to reheat and finish cooking the prawns.
recipeInstructions.name: Cook for 2 minutes just to reheat and finish cooking the prawns.

itemListElement.text: Place noodles in bowl. Ladle over soup.
itemListElement.name: Place noodles in bowl. Ladle over soup.

itemListElement.text: Top with bean sprouts and coriander, plus toppings of choice (chilli, red onion, Asian fried shallots).
itemListElement.name: Top with bean sprouts and coriander, plus toppings of choice (chilli, red onion, Asian fried shallots).

itemListElement.text: Squeeze over lime juice to taste. Slurp and be happy!
itemListElement.name: Squeeze over lime juice to taste. Slurp and be happy!

review.reviewBody: I hadn't seen this recipe until last week when someone shared it in the recipe tin eats appreciation Facebook group. And I'm so pleased they did, it's amazing! Subbed chicken for the prawns cos I hate prawns, was delish.

Cold, rainy night in Sydney tonight so I decided to make this. OMG Nagi!!!! Another winner. The flavours were just beautiful. I added some chicken and shiitake mushrooms to make it go further for my family. Thank you for your wonderful recipes
AMAZING. I added bok choy, julienned carrots and green onions to the broth at the end to soften and it was DIVINE.
Made this last night, and it was a hit! Thank you for this amazing recipe üòã

Okay, this is AMAZING! I‚Äôm a Thai food connoisseur, and kind of hard to impress because I lived there for 9 months a few years ago. This is basically Khao Soi, which I didn‚Äôt realize until I tasted it (the only big difference is khao soi is typically made with chicken drumsticks). Khao soi is my favourite dish, and it‚Äôs so hard to find at Thai restaurants around Canada. Make this! You won‚Äôt regret it üëåüèºüëåüèºüëåüèº 
Another recipe by recipetineats for my tried and true album!

Yum! We had this with mixed asian mushrooms, pak choy, bok choy  and bean sprouts to push the dish so there would be leftovers. Just used the Japanese style noodles as that‚Äôs what we had. Our local fruit shop has massive frozen prawns that go perfect in this dish.
Yum! Only change I made was adding some thinly sliced mushrooms and a tsp of red Thai curry paste instead of chilli paste. So, so, tasty. Thank you Nagi and team :)

keywords: Coconut Curry Soup, Thai coconut soup
